Understate: The claim may understate the extent to which the US ranks low in per capita Covid-19 testing.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a single source (a Vox article) and may not provide a comprehensive view of global testing rankings.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that per capita testing is the sole measure of a country's response to the pandemic, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the low ranking in per capita testing, such as differences in testing strategies and reporting methods among countries.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts President Trump's statement that the US has conducted more tests than any other nation, suggesting a contradiction in facts.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times due to the lack of a central source of statistics on testing in the US and the varying ways in which testing data is compiled by states and localities.
Exaggerate: It is unclear if the claim exaggerates the situation, as it is based on limited information and may not provide a comprehensive picture of global testing rankings.
